subject: Re: [junit] false positives with  expected=AnException.class?
msgSnippet: Bernd, This is certainly true, and if it s a concern, try/fail/catch is always available.  Or you can move everything in the test method except the
messageBody:
Bernd,

This is certainly true, and if it's a concern, try/fail/catch is always
available. Or you can move everything in the test method except the
exception-throwing portion into @Before and @After, which sometimes is useful,
and sometimes not. Thanks,

David Saff

Quoting berndq <berndq@...>:

>
> Hi all,
>
> I can see that this is nicer than a try/fail/catch construct.
>
> But what if the same exception type is thrown from another place
> than the expected one (inside the same test method)? Can't we have false
> positives then?
>
>
> best regards
> Bernd
